intro: Mentzelia longiloba var. yavapaiensis, commonly known as Yavapai ghostflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pale blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments, such as desert scrub and grasslands. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. This species is often found in areas with limited water availability, showcasing its adaptation to harsh, dry conditions.
